rComments: By far the best professor I have had. The textbook he provides (free)  is actually interesting  so I highly suggest trying to keep up with the readings because it will definitely help you. Overall Storm is a great teacher who keeps his lectures fun and engaging. His test is very practical and focuses on concepts instead of pointless memorization(:

Storm is freaking awesome. I loved his lectures and teaching style. But you can't expect to read just his slides if you want to do well on the test. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. For the midterm I was one of maybe 4 people that went to his 3 hour long office hours, where he answered every question I could possibly have and helped so much for the test.

He taught Psychology 1 and I absolutely loved it. He made the class interesting and provided example questions that would be on the midterm and a long study guide. The readings weren't too heavy and he made the class very lively. He always found time to answer questions as well.

Professor Storm is one of the best professors at UCSC. I think he is very clear and concise in what he is teaching and wants us to learn. Everything that he talks about in lecture will be on the midterm. The book is not mandatory. You can get an A without reading the book. Do the extra credit and you will get an A.  Also, he is very handsome!

Storm was a great lecturer. He made the class funny and interesting. Normally I'm not very interested in cog psyc, but Storm was one of the best teachers I've had here. I didn't study much, and on the three midterms I got an 87%, and 83% and a 78%. There is also one paper and a final. I'm an AB student and I think I'll get a B+ with minimal effort

Two midterms and a final, multiple choice. Straightforward if you attend class. Make sure to select the best answer over a correct one. If you are interested in graduate school or research, or have questions, he is a good person to talk to. He is blunt and informative.

Some really interesting material, Storm does an excellent job of discussing it in lecture.  Very fair about his tests and quizzes, but attendance is the key.  The sections are optional, but those who went found them to be extremely helpful towards taking the exams later on.  Overall, Ben does a great job teaching such a vast and interesting topic.

Ben is a fantastic teacher and researcher. Although I felt that his lectures at the beginning of the quarter were a little bit dry, his lectures quickly became the highlight of my week. His exams and quizzes were extremely fair, and he made sure (and cared!) that his students absorbed the material. I definitely recommend if you are a Cog Sci major.
Rude, inflated ego, and quick to judge.

Take this class. Storm's class is pretty basic topics that are interesting but helpful. Exams based on lecture only, didn't do the readings still managed an A. Tests are easy if you study, he lets you have 1 page notes for test. No papers only 3 tests that are cumulative. Once in a while during lecture gives chance for extra credit. Great class!

This class was difficult even if you went to class but it was not un-manageable. The book was only used for a few random questions on the exam. Your entire grade is based off 2 quizzes a midterm and a final. Occasionally gives extra credit for attending class.

If you are curious or interested in cog psych research, I highly recommend Storm's classes as you will receive a solid foundation in research methods and the course material. Discussions are much more interesting if you keep up with the readings. Don't be afraid to ask questions and make mistakes, he is supportive.You will get out what you put in.
He made the class interesting by giving examples pertaining directly to studying for exams... useful learning and memory techniques.
Take this class if you want to ruin your GPA.
Look up his profile on University of Chicago Illinois. He has low ratings for a reason. Beware.
Pretty much everything you need to know is in lecture. If you go to every class and take good notes you'll do fine. He's good at getting info into your head
Makes a simple topic too complicated.

Too bad his classes aren't podcasted, it would of helped to understand the material better. He posts his lecture notes after class, found that to be redundant for those who actually want learn something (write on slides during lecture). Gives out an exam study guide but puts random stuff on the exam that isn't on the sheet. Too difficult.

His professor is DIFFICULT!!! Exams are ridiculous!! His lectures are confusin and he doesn't go over them but tests you on questions that trick you. There are two midterms, one final and two quizzes. There is no research paper to buffer your grade and no he lied sayin each extra credit is worth 5 points when it's actually just 1 point! Avoid him!!
Great class and teacher! 4 quizzes, 2 test, 1 research ppr. class is mandatory if you want to get a good grade!! interesting topic! you will have an awesome time! :)
